oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: 1876 Colored National Convention scene
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Illustration of scene in the House of Representatives Chamber, Tennessee State Capitol, from the 1876 National Colored Convention in Nashville. The Grand Chandelier measured 45 feet across and was removed in 1889. This image is based on a photograph by C. C. Giers.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Giers, C.C.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Chandeliers; Politicans; Capitols; Drawings; Flags
